column1: Croatia have advanced to the semi-finals of the World Cup for the second consecutive tournament after a 4-2 penalty shootout victory over Brazil following a 1-1 draw in the quarter-final. Neymar had seemingly put the Selecao on the brink of the last four with a stunning goal in the first period of extra time
column2: but Bruno Petkovic equalised with a deflected effort to keep Croatia alive in the second half of extra time. Dominik Livakovic then made a crucial save from Rodrygo Silva's penalty
column3: and Zlatko Dalic's team were perfect in the shootout
column4: with Marquinhos' attempt hitting the post and sending Croatia through and Brazil out of the tournament at the quarter-final stage.
